text: I love me a good anomaly in the options market and what better than GameStop. We have a really interesting position today and even if you're not necessarily a big GameStop person, there's some really important details in here for options traders writ large. There's a great lesson. So today in the 19 July 24 expiration cycle, the 30 calls, they had pretty high volume and they actually kicked off a couple different alerts that I have except this one was really weird. Let me show you why. If we first start with what is a bid, what is an ask? The bid is the most somebody is willing to buy something for right now and then the ask is the cheapest somebody is willing to sell for right now. So that means that if I want to buy something as a trader, you have to essentially be near the ask to do it right now, right the second. You can always try to play the mid price. That's more of a negotiation process of back and forth, typically. So if I want to buy something right now, this second and get a fill, you got to go towards the ask. If I want to sell something right now, I would have to go towards the bid. So what's going on here? Well, this is looking at the 30s, a lot of transactions today and this is filtering by stuff that's 50 lots and over. There's way more than this,
